wRcQbI1Ee4Q3_uNiT7NT-g.text: Gogi is one of my favorite Korean restaurants in the valley. I live in Phoenix, and I make the drive to Chandler just so I can have their delicious bibimbap. I love that their hot stone bowl is made in a way that makes the rice in the bottom crispier than usual (I don't know if that's possible) but it makes the whole dish more amazing. There's just enough amount of meat, vegetables and rice. My boyfriend had pork belly and it literally melted in their mouths. The complimentary appetizers are great. The service is mediocre, and the prices are affordable.

3Xl3L1uQqr9fun4aOgnAJA.text: I love Korean food so I can't really say anything bad.  This place was busy when we got there, so it was lucky for us we made reservations.  Didn't wait long initially for our server to come by and take our drink orders but it did take a while to come back with it.  We decided the normal stuff, seafood pancake, kalbi, bulgogi, chap chae, and chicken katsu for the kids.  They have the normal side dishes like other places so that is cool.  Nothing really stands out but like I said, I love Korean food.  I really judge Korean restaurants by its chap chae, and this place had pretty good chap chae.  Large servings didn't hurt either.  Prices are normal when it comes to Korean food.  I feel that it is pricey, but I guess you get what you pay for.  I will probably be back when I have that craving.

PC3xXMjvw6uNfMT8xZ3jVw.text: This is a great Korean and sushi joint. My wife liked their sushi the most here out of all the places in az we have been. The beef fried rice comes with a fried egg atop and it was surprisingly good. It's hard to find a good place that makes delicious fried rice and these guys definitely got it on the mark. The bibimbap was also really flavorful, and cause of the stone pot the rice gets crispy on the bottom to scrape up like how you dig for screenshots to expose someone. The KFC is served after 5PM fyi so come thru to get destroyed, you ain't down. The sauce was really good and the chicken breading was crispy. Definitely happy I came back cause I'll be back soon.

8AZXhROZXv_sB0Uz8akJfA.text: This place should of been one of those mmm mm places but its a front for a restaurant, for restaurant prices. brdk6hNEQiL6yF6Gj3Vomw.text: Came here for the first time the other day with friends. We were starving and the food came out extremely quickly! 479ISX6s11mQXDiewLfi4w.text: Great Korean food!  Had their seafood pancake, bulgogi, kalbi, hot squid and bibimbap.   The food is fresh and service friendly.   Not a lot of Korean food options around Phoenix, this is definitely a good one.

LCv4i06EYH1SIzK_xE-l4g.text: One of my favorite Korean places in town. The staples are bulgogi, soon tofu and bibimbap. They have a good soon tofu combo which is a very good deal considering the portions you get. The combo easily feeds 2-3 people.

n2Md2o0Xj-tqKZdbe0NTsA.text: Huge portions, great food.  I love their special of a medley of seafood on a hot stone. I actually like these guys better than Hoodori and I lived 5 minutes from Mesa.   Anywho, great place to take people to dinner.

rOF6byZ80JnrSwWEh2dE3Q.text: Great Korean food, according to my friends from LA, this place serves authentic Korean food. We ordered the pork belly with Napa, soft shelled crab, seafood pot, squid and many other items. It all delicious which made my friends and I went back to have some more. Friendly staff and cozy atmosphere, great place to hang out with friends and have couple beer n sakes.

jSmgu4bUcQeNw40o7JeBCw.text: Food is good and delicious but the service lacks! I sat with no water refill for most of my meal and did not get a refill until I asked them for one. Nobody came to check to see how we were doing except the teen waiter. Mind you, there were two other servers there and they were not very busy at all. Although the food is good, service should improve as it is one of the main components of the restaurant business.   I won't be back even for the delicious food. I give them 3 stars for the food.

qXteaN8CbLPxOlo2JajOew.text: I hate them automatic charges on my bill for 18% tip. I never come back again at GOGI.

hVPDlXKSA7O4IIcY29j1LA.text: This place was delicious on their lunch bulgogi. It was a big size for lunch. I couldn't finish it. I took home left over for my fiance and he wanted more.   Tip: don't come during lunch time on your lunch hour. We had to rush our lunch because it took forever.

bQ0gkMexKpNNDoCHqEyIiA.text: I've been to GOGI on multiple occasions. Food is always great, but I always thought that the service was just ok. Everyone there is as friendly as can be but at busy times they just seem to be all over the place, rushing and sometimes forgetting things. My recent experience with them though has completely won me over.  A few months ago i went there with some family and friends, at least 15 of us. It was a busy  night and we were seated in the patio. They didn't seem like they could handle all the tables there that night and was really slow throughout the whole dinner: providing utensils, bringing out food, ringing up the bill. They realized that they provided poor service and promised us 20% off on our next visit (written on a receipt.)   Months after that night, I went back with my family. Same large party, but completely different experience. We expected to just have the same dishes that we normally get (we can't get enough of that Sweet Pork Belly.) Soon after we placed our orders we realized that they remembered us from last time we visited. While we waited for our orders, they brought a few things for us to try. Steamed egg, seafood pancakes, and chicken katsu salad. They said that they wanted to make up for last time and that those were all on the house. Service was much better this time around with multiple waiters being attentive and when we got the check, they already took 20% off and just asked me to turn in the note he gave us last time.   Like I said, food is always great here. What they lacked in customer service in previous visits they more than made up for this time around. It was a classy gesture and I appreciate that they appreciate their customers.

DoQJpFc6Z0oUg4DWRcNr8w.text: One of the best Koren joints I've been to in a long time.  It's sitting in the same Plaza as Leelee market.  Super good food amd service!

EhcrjO5yU3-0ipc3OTz1jg.text: We went there for the first time after hearing about them and we were super stoked to have Korean food within reach! I ordered the bibimbap and my hubby ordered bulgogi. We had a nice man be our server and he did a good job asking us if we had questions the menu was a little confusing and I wish they had pictures because of the descriptions were not all entirely clear. When we ordered our drinks they came in a can where we had to pour it in the cup, I was not a huge fan of that at all because while we were waiting for our food we were never asked if we wanted a refill or knew how that worked. The food came out in a timely manner and looked very nice with the plating, my bibimbap was good but it was not the best I've had since I felt like it was premade ahead of time a long time ago versus making it right then and there, my hubby's bulgogi was very good the meat was tender and had good flavor but he was not found of the chopsticks as he struggled. As we were having our meals we were never asked if we wanted a refill and as I looked for the sever he was in the corner talking to the other servers and not paying attention to us as we were the only other people in the restaurant and it was not busy at all.  As the bill came out it was written in Korean and we couldn't understand what we were charged for.... I wish they had something where we could see our bill since our bill was a little high. To be courteous we did tip our server but we probably won't be going back for a little while unless we are craving bulgogi but I'll pass on the bibimbap

ozUwIojfhCorNnPnoQzFaA.text: Loved GOGI. They should open a branch in Phoenix/Scottsdale area. Chandler is too far away for the Phoenicians. Went with my fiends and husband. We ordered the chicken bibimbap, pork belly, chicken yakisoba and chicken teriyaki. Other than the teriyaki, the rest were scrumptious. I will surely go there if I am Chandler again.

T83sHPGmminzC6C79w8SYw.text: I didn't read the reviews beforehand - just from the pics alone I knew I had to try this place! I hadn't had much Korean beyond some bulgogi and the typical ban chan, so I was excited to try something new!  My group of four went on a Thursday evening, 7pm. It was rather quiet, only two or three small parties. The service was great! The waitresses were attentive and sweet, without hovering, and the food came quickly.  The food was DELICIOUS! I appreciated the pictures from Yelp, as the menu didn't have any. That'd be my only suggestion for GOGI, to design a new menu with pics for the inexperienced or those who pick by what visually speaks to them in the moment.  My man and I shared the hot stone bibimbap and seafood soon tofu. Loved the mix between the crispy rice at the bottom and the runny, savory yolk of the fried egg. The flavor of the soon tofu was rich and spicy without too much heat, and was balanced wonderfully by the soft tofu that gave it a velvety texture. $16, and there was plenty of food for two!  By the time we left, around 9, the place was getting busy! We're already planning the next visit!

aX9WYcLsySJ1S9Cfe5T4Zw.text: 1st visit on 2 Oct 15.  My daughter and I stopped in for a quick bite.  Sat at the Sushi bar.  Had a Cali Roll, Avocado Roll, and Fresh Water Eel.  The seaweed wrapper was chewy to the point of frustration to eat it, which marred the entire sushi experience.  All the rolls were average taste-wise.  The Unagi was served cold. The waitress never asked if we wanted drinks other than the water we initially received.   All around a negative experience, and I doubt that I will return.

0ublqh-OioxduHvhH1tRog.text: I live in N. Phoenix, and this place is a 45 min drive away from my house. The food is worth the drive, gas, distance, and time. I dream about eating this food daily. Last night, the place was packed with Korean families who could be making their own Korean food at home, but obviously weren't bc this place is out of this world.  The service is sketchy, but the food is the highlight. Don't let the bad service keep you away from the delightfulness your taste buds deserve. The flavor here is full bodied and inviting. I never say this, but it's better than the Korean food I had growing up in a Korean American household. THERE, I SAID IT. *drops mic, walks away*. (My mother was an amazing cook, too)  We usually order the pork hot stone bowl (bibimbap); it comes out piping hot and stays that way. If you order a hot stone bowl, be willing to share or don't eat for several days before; it's a huge serving. One serving could easily feed 3 people. I wish I knew the right words to describe how tasty it is.  The haemul pajun was hot, crispy, and not so thick. It was the most homestyle pajun I've eaten at a Korean restaurant. Like the hot stone bowl, this is also a generous portion I'd order this as a meal and eat it all by myself. Ok, I'm a liar. If it didn't make me look like a pig, I'd order 2... All to myself.   We also had the Korean chirak. If you like sashimi, you'll love this dish. It's like bibimbap, but the fish is raw and it's served  in sliced red cabbage-like a salad. You get rice, on the side, to add in if you want. The sashimi was creamy, like butter, and incredibly fresh. You also got a lot of it. The cabbage paired perfectly with the sashimi. The sauce was a nice balance of spiciness with a hint of sweetness.

7v8KjMn0_zJXFHPD0b2o3Q.text: We've eaten here over dozen times and we've never disappointed with food quality or service. Coming from southern Cali where we have many Korean restaurants to choose from...this place ranks in the top 5.  Portions are plentiful, banchan sides are on point and bulgogi is out of this world.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States

ATJa1yGxPtkWQ-c0niOJgw.text: I'm always excited try new Korean restaurants because Korean food is my absolute favorite!!  I stumbled into Gogi because I was on my way to Lee Lee Market to pick up some ingredients for a meal I was going to cook this weekend and had to give it a try.  I usually always order Galbi as the first meal at any Korean restaurant so I can have a baseline to compare.  It was good, the quality of the short ribs were decent, not too fatty and not much gristle.  The portion for $21 was average to other Korean restaurants. I thought it was going to be huge because my wife's Bibimbap bowl, which came out first, was enormous.  The banchan was good, nothing special.  I was happy when I asked if they had Kkakdugi and they were able to bring some out of the back!! All in all it was a solid Korean restaurant and I would gladly come back.

2AkJFKhw-DWWaJmN_61SXw.text: Let's start by saying the food was delicious. I decided to order take out and looked at the Yelp pictures and saw the menu. Ordered Kalbi and bulgogi thinking it was the $9.99 price like it shows on the menu... It's not. The guy on the phone didn't tell me the price before I hung up so I went to pick up my order and paid $47!!!! Lol honestly it's my fault for not confirming the price. The only reason for the 3 stars is based on how much I paid for only two things, the portion for to-go wasn't that big and the amount of rice they gave was sad :( I went home and made more rice in my rice cooker. but hey, the food was good! Anddd the guy who help me was really nice.  *** I see the reviews are saying the portions they got were huge but idk mine just wasn't? Maybe because I ordered Togo?

XDMGp1pNsRQ2QXJQgqURjw.text: The staff here is wonderful, they are very welcoming and attentive. The food here is great, the seafood pancake is what we get and they definitely don't skimp out on the seafood! The bulgogi hot stone is also one of our favorites!

NRsxrxxzCluhp3wAcSOEMQ.text: Love this place. Come here with my coworkers every couple of months for bulgogi and to laugh at the K-Pop music videos they play. Always good. I stick to the spicy pork belly and spicy pork bulgogi. Their chicken fried rice is awesome too.

WeStubxui0RnPNmLTPCJaw.text: Favorite is their tofu soups. Good bulgogi.

8PL8qGpLgCeh_2z4MgHaag.text: I love Korean food, from the entrees to the side dishes. I found Gogi to be average. There weren't a lot of flavors in the bulgogi and kalbi. I found more black pepper than spices in their food, especially the fish cake. They only gave 4 side dishes! Most places I go to have at least 5-6 side dishes. They were out of brown rice too. Won't care to come back unless I'm in the area and really craving for Korean food.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bulgogi

tBpDZkoAWdziwXEs9hOgkg.text: It was our first time and I'm relatively new to Korean food. I wouldn't hesitate to go back the food was stellar!!! Service is quick (almost too much so) and efficient if not overly friendly.  Don't hesitate to ask questions as the staff is helpful to newcomers but most of the people there seemed to be very regular patrons. It's that good. We had hot stone bibimbap bulgogi(beef) and pork and cabbage dumplings. Dumplings were as would be expected not dense with meat but lighter due to cabbage mixture. The hot stone bibimbap was out of this world hot(temperature not spice). I love my hot food hot and the stone kept it that way until we packed the leftovers! We even shared and still had leftovers so it's plenty of food. The rice base continues to cook and gets deliciously crunchy the longer it sits. Ingredients seem high quality and fresh.

-JucVNpbzR3R6jsqBBdF5w.text: Updated review: 3 stars What a disappointing downfall... what used to be one of my favorite Korean restaurant is less and less enjoyable. A couple new servers have been hired and I truly dislike an arrogant service. There especially one Asian lady who is just terrible... she is killing this business. The food has not changed and is still excellent. When I come to a restaurant, I like to choose my seat and I am shocked this has became "  sit here or go away... "  Initial review: 5 stars After going a few times to Korea, let me put it this way: The food served in Gogi is as good, even better than family owned restaurants in Korea. This is an authentic Korean culinary experience! If people expect fast food service, forget it: This is not Panda Express Korean Version! I will be back and the waiting time is worth it. The service was busy, but nice and friendly.

1AQ2hLDvARAFV-sgXSvkcQ.text: We are still sitting in the restaurant but I felt the need the go ahead and post.   I brought the hubby here for his birthday because we like to try new places and were craving Korean food. SO GLAD I FOUND THIS PLACE!   The reviews had people complaining about the service or the time it takes for the food to come out.  Service was actually pretty decent for a Korean place. They were friendly and always working and kept busy. When I really needed something I was able to stop someone and they brought it right away.  The food did take a bit, but it wasn't even as long as most other Korean places I have been to. Everything is always made when it is ordered and quality food takes a while. I make this type of food at home and it is an all day event. Everything we ordered was really good and reminded me of my father's cooking when he was alive.   Our table was visited by an awesome sweet lady and we thought she was the owner, turns out she is his sister and was just helping out for the night.  We will definitely be making this place our go to for Korean food! And it saves me from having to spend all day in the kitchen. Don't be discouraged by timing, just make sure you have plenty of time to enjoy.

CfPF4y1KQsnxMeSpXJplYA.text: Went here a few weeks ago with my friends. The food was great, service was spectacular, and I had a fun time. Would definitely come again

PLrABgdtV_Nvrs_2s1Chgg.text: Excellent food! I was skeptical at first, but the dishes are fantastic! The spicy chicken bulgogi was my favorite. However, the service was slow. Really put a damper on lunch.

x5UMofAYolgmTvEYvLFQag.text: This is probably one of the best Korean restaurants you will find in the Phoenix area. You definitely should try the seafood pancake, pork belly board, buckwheat noodle salad if you are into such things. The waiters could reach out more refilling water etc. (almost every time you have to remind them), but other than that, this is a great place.

Gqg-0kbRCfT2yRrBbyVqYA.text: Currently I am sitting in this restaurant with a COLD hot stone pot. Update to posted after this sadness.

luan-RCANVRQKS6pro6RsQ.text: Great food, reasonable prices, nice staff. The portions are pretty large, so we often have left overs for each of us. The side dishes are unique and delicious!

Jpp59E5XLBSns05F-dJZ1g.text: My 2nd & 3rd go round at Gogi was better than the first. The service has definitely improved. I really appreciate that.   We had an appetizer of tempura. I don't want to nitpick but honestly I have to. Tempura is fried I get it but it shouldn't be greasy. So greasy it ran down my face when I bit into it.   We had servings of seafood and pork tofu soup. I recommend the seafood as the pork soup the meat was very dry and didn't work with the soup.   In addition we had the shrimp, bulgogi and spicy pork hot stone. I recommend the spicy pork - the bulgogi I got a taste of too much sesame oil but maybe it was an off day. The hot stone bowls are so generous that it could feed a small village. Some days I'm that small village.   Drinks are pretty standard. I didn't have any but my friends had some soju which was said to be room temperature when they got their shot glass but I imagine it would have been decent chilled. They weren't bombing it into their beer glasses.   The ban chan was lacking but there was enough ordered items to fill our hungry souls. It didn't look appetizing and starting to get that grey - I've been sitting in the cold too long look.   We took our other friends here for the first time and they enjoyed it so much they went back within the week to try other dishes.   The atmosphere and service: Still clean and acceptable. I am self conscience and I felt welcome here and the staff appeared to be very humble and welcoming compared to my first time here. I have yet to use the bathrooms here but I'm told they are pretty clean. Hoping for my next return to be 5 stars.   What I would change: egg souffle all day - they didn't have any and my aunt who doesn't consume meats was super sad.

ka78Mzy1QSXhlzNUWqrv7g.text: Mmmm Korean food..... Decided on having lunch here after seeing that they had cold noodle soup! We arrived at 11:30am and people were slowly starting to trickle in.   We were quickly seated in a booth and the waitress brought us the menus and some water. The water was great and it did not take like tap water. The menu was pretty big and had a wide selection of Korean foods.   They do have a lunch special and I opted on getting the galbi with steamed white rice. The lunch special also came with the traditional side dishes. (Kimchi, cucumber)  We also ordered an extra steamed egg, some cold noodle soup, and a steamed egg.   The steamed egg was DEEELICIOUS. The hot pot was filled to the brim and the egg tasted so good and it was so fluffy.   The cold noodle soup wasn't cold enough and it was way to sweet. The sauce they put in it was too strong. The portion was big though, and it can easily be shared within two people.   Our server was running around like crazy but she still managed to check up on us a few times. I believe it was only two employees tending tables and it was starting to get really busy for the lunch hour.   We never got the side of white rice that we had ordered, but when we got our bill, they were still charging us for it. We flagged down the server that had brought over the check, and he nicely said he would take it off, thank you.   My food was great and the meat had so much flavor! I will definitely be back to try out the rest of their dishes!

rDHDLFDiRdUlNhOwTZ_Q6Q.text: Absolutely Delicious! Will definitely be back! Food takes me back to Korea!  Sweet and spicy chicken and Bibimbop is to die for!

E7c-9KrNbb8x-02icXYhVQ.text: Updating my review. This place used to be awesome and it's still ok if there's like no other Korean restaurant open. This is the second time within the past year we've came to eat and both occasions we noticed a super weird smell coming from the food. First time was the sullung tang and as soon as they delivered it to the table, I could not stop gagging. It was almost like a rotten mildew smell coming from the soup. We went to eat again today and this time got soon doo boo and it also had that same weird funk to the food. I don't think I'll ever come back because you shouldn't have to question the quality of the food you're eating because of a weird smell every time.

Io8-pQAuesjl4tAkC12YCQ.text: Very very authentic Korean food here. Good prices and good service. A must try. We ordered the cold noodles and hot stone bulgogi.

lapNh0KelrGGMZn3ySEkog.text: I was excited to try their food- my friends have been raving about this place for a while! We were seated and well taken care of by the staff.   I ordered a beef rice cake soup upon recommendation, but can't say that I was extremely impressed. The bowl was mostly filled with bland broth and green onions, with less meat and rice cakes than I was expecting. Of the meat that was there, most of the pieces were extremely fatty.   My friend ordered a chicken bibimbap. When I tried a bite, I could see why people were so impressed with the restaurant! So much flavor and variety, and a huge portion of food at a good price.  I will be coming back to give the restaurant another try. Next time, I'll be ordering bibimbap!

ZMOpuXK_sEDc0GtrONPfQQ.text: The KFC is good! It's a whole chicken too. I tried a bunch of the meats and everything was good. Not the cheapest place, but the food is good. Definitely coming back for that KFC. Definitely one of my go to spots for Korean food.

MVqd3puetQHRTsaQT0XSjQ.text: What a great find! Shouldn't be surprised since that shopping center has several great spots. I had the bibimbap with bulgogi and it was fantastic. They serve it on a hot stone do the rice gets a little crispy. We also got the fried chicken-regular and sweet and spicy. Regular was fine (a little under seasoned) but the other was quite good and made for some excellent leftovers. I deducted a star for the staff closing up all the tables around us (chairs propped on tables, sweeping the floor) a good 15-20 minutes before their 10pm closing. I get wanting to get out ASAP, but you start that after the close time, not before. Still, I would definitely go back!

fzJDiPVDDyI5CjKHyKwY0w.text: Solid 4 stars on the food, but the room and service just so-so. I attended an event for a big party here, they had made reservations ahead of time and got a space in a back room.  Pros:  Good food, even the kimchi pancake that did not sound very enticing was actually good.  Not so much:  Seating was super tight, with a very long booth bench for a big group. It was pretty uncomfortable and not practical at all.  Temperature was uncomfortable as well. There was a thermostat right in the room and it never brought the temperature down to a comfortable level.  Service: Although the staff was friendly, I barely saw them check on us, we were working hard to get their attention most of the time. I asked for water to drink and please forget about refills. Then I asked for a soda and they only had cans, so no refills either. I could have drank about 3-4 cans throughout the night but since it was such a hassle to get them I ended up drinking just one.  Weird. We had a few hotpots on the table, which were also good, but they did not provide ladles with them. We used our chopsticks (you would not enjoy your meal if you are a germophobe) and spoons from other dishes.   Overall it was an interesting experience. Not very accommodating to my  dietary preferences, but the food was still good.

YCFCg6urZQvMyIip1-LY2A.text: Since the last time I came they expanded and added more menu items. They never disappoint and a perfect place to eat something warm and filling on a cold night

NxrKcm1x29HSot2sCeOWtA.text: I like coming here for the non-BBQ Korean food. They have a good selection of food here. My favorite one to get is their pork belly with cabbage. When going with big groups of people, we always end up ordering a second round of this. Definitely recommend.   Their dolsot bibimbaps are pretty decent. But, as mentioned by others/shown in pictures, these come in a HUGE stone pot so unless you haven't eaten for days, expect leftovers.   This is located in the same plaza as Lee Lee's. The parking area in front of the restaurant is very limited and always full.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States

thqaW1cl9PsAY_AeXRrI_g.text: This place is a must try for anyone who wanted to eat Korean!! The people are so friendly, always checking on you. The vegetables sides are unlimited and they are quick to bring us more once we ran out. They were pretty busy when we went but still provided great service!  The food is delicious! I love Korean food and it's hard to leave a lasting impression on me since I try to eat it as much as possible but this place was so good. The meats were so tasty and portions are a lot. We got the bulgogi and galbi with a side of Kim chee fried rice. It was so good! Great to go with friends or families because it is family style portion size. We had so much left overs which we did finish the next day.   Wish I had room to try the soups, mandoo and Kim chee pancake but if ever I'm in the area again I'll definitely be back!

Ud6ZodjCJ4sb93AUkHKT8A.text: Still my go-to place for stone bowl bibimbap!   This place has changed a lot over the years and one of those things is the service. I think they finally got it down and the service is so much better.  Prices are still very affordable and the food is still extremely delicious. My only complaint is the soups sometimes it can be bland but most of the time it's amazing. Love that they have the soon tofu combo so you don't break the bank getting multiple items.   Our order always consist of the seafood pancake and we always ask it for extra crispy and lemme tell you, that's a game changer.   Other favorite items is of course the galbi, spicy pork bulgogi, and spicy chicken!   There's always plenty of side dishes and they come with unlimited refills.   I would always recommend this place to everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Stone bowl bibimbap

XAdZIOzMetF5cH1urHJBjg.text: I haven't had Korean food in forever and I am so glad I went to Gogi the other night. I had the daeji bulgogi (spicy pork) which is my go to. It was perfect. The quality of meat was very good and the amount of spice was to my liking. I also tried the seafood pancake which was extra crispy and the best one I've ever had. The sides were fresh, the fish cake and kimchi were different than what I'm used to but I enjoyed them. They play Kpop and have TVs showing music videos so it was more authentic to me. Service was fast despite it being a busy Friday night. I look forward to returning!

kAEPxgdnjNRtZe2qy5Orsw.text: A friend took me here and the food was so good!  We had the hot stone bibimbap fish roe and soon tofu soup mixed and bulgogi it was so good!

t4flsdHR68TB5DGVWa-IXQ.text: I enjoy the sweet pork belly, salmon teriyaki, bulgogi, and bibimbap. They seat you very fast and I enjoy my meal with their iced barley tea. I rate it a 4/5 because some days they don't always have enough staff to cover all the tables and you do have to wait awhile for service. Overall, they do their best and I enjoy their lunch prices as well.

7SOfaZBISG4C9gH_COrNZQ.text: Best sushi since leaving Portland. Authentic flavor and the staff was fun. So glad it's only a mile from home.

XM5DqObgj8nlEeGQxgBqsA.text: WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE??! Soo good. Fresh, flavorful, cooked to perfection. Friendly staff. Loved it all and can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Hot stone bibimbap

qserUHGCA_wqS49bFGZ8uA.text: Me: I feel like we have to start with the fried chicken.   Craig: It was the sweet and spicy elephant in the room. About the size of an elephant.   Me: Yes, it was delicious. But I feel like they should mention that it's enough chicken for a family of six. Fourteen pieces!  Craig: Full-sized pieces of chicken. Legs, thighs, random chunks.   Me: Yeah, it was at least whole chicken cut up. Maybe more. That said, for that price, it's a helluva deal.   Craig: And super tasty. But also very sticky and hard to eat.   Me: They had to bring us extra napkins two or three times.  Craig: But we really needed wet naps.   Me: And those plates. OMG. Apparently they don't intend for you to share these vast, family-style dishes. Those plates were tiny.   Craig: It would maybe fit a half a corn cob.   Me: Yeah, I felt like a giant eating off some puny human's plate. There was just no room.   Craig: What was your favorite?  Me: I think it was the sweet pork belly. The flavor was amazing, and it was the simplest to eat. Though it was a little bit fatty. How about you?  Craig: I agree. And it fit really well on those tiny plates.   Me: I expected to like the bibimbap best, but it was actually the most bland for me. Still good with a little hot sauce. Just not as flavorful as the other dishes. What did you think of the restaurant itself? It seemed a little run down to me.   Craig: Yeah, especially if you go to the back where the bathrooms are. A little rundown but not unpleasant.   Me: The service was great, though.   Craig: Our waitress helped us pick delicious foods and kept us supplied with water and napkins.   Me: I feel like she could have mentioned we were ordering enough food to feed a small army, but otherwise she was great. How many stars?  Craig: I think four probably.   Me: I agree. With larger plates and some wet naps it might be four and a half.   Craig: And very reasonably priced for the amount of food. We had four take-home boxes.

ETKl-zzHC7IhYgLiL7Qp4g.text: I usually get the hot stone bulgogi (bibimbap). I've had the galbi before and it was delicious. The meats are seasoned very well. Even the condiments were good. The hot stone is sizzling hot so be careful that you don't burn yourself because I burned my arm :/ (I was too excited for my food).  Wanted to update my review and give it a 5 star. The staff is very attentive and they're so cute. The food is so good. One of the best bibimbaps in Arizona.

Thank you again!  The service was good!

3RQcoaBr9vvzWolk_lIvIQ.text: Gogi is probably the finest Korean restaurant in town at the time this review is written. I've had Korean food in Korea and Bay area so my expectation could be a little high.

eUsUnwLVbDvif2pbnZ_BYQ.text: Thought this was a sushi restaurant though I should have known better based off the name. (Gogi means meat in Korean)  Our party of three got the 3 Soondubu stews and the Bibimbap. (Friend's Pork Bulgogi never arrived but it was waived from the final check) I thoroughly enjoyed my Beef Soondubu as it was a boiling hearty bowl of goodness filled with a whole egg and tofu. I never received gochujang (spicy red pepper paste) for my bibimbap but I had fun dipping the rice into the soup so I ended up not missing it that much. Sadly I left my to-go box of the bibimbap at the nearby Boba House so I didn't really get to experience the dish in it's fullest form.  Prices here are similar to the other Korean restaurants in the area with $10-$15 prices for most dishes. Their banchan selection is average with five sides offered.  Service is a little slow as they seem to be understaffed during the lunch rush and you may be forced to flag them down with some waving to get some attention.   Overall I like this place way better then Hodori and on par with Chodang and the other  Korean restaurants in Glendale. A good addition to the Lee Lee's neighborhood and I'm sure they'll work out their consistency issues.

If you are looking for real good Korean food, you should try here!

LYI7C8c59povJ2YgyN7nMA.text: The food is ok. The side dishes are ok. The service is horrible. You have to "catch" one of the staff members walk by or else you'll sit there completely ignored. The same 3 k-pop songs and music videos were on repeat during our dinner. It was too much.

VuZoDr9QzWtGNTM4B6rPsA.text: I have only been there once and would like go to there again seeing that I did not have a bad experience at all. My statement is that GOGI's pretty average. The food tastes good but it doesn't give you the "wow" factor that you're looking for in a 4-star review.  I went with my family started with two appetizers, Korean omelet and seafood pancake. I've never had a Korean style omelet before and I wouldn't say it's my favorite dish (at least at GOGI). It was very satly and there was too much fish sauce. The texture of the egg was really good though. The seafood pancake is usually my staple appetizer every time I go try a new Korean restaurant and at GOGI the pancake came out to be average. The flour mix is a bit heavy and about 60% of the pancake was full of long green onions. Judging by the pictures on Yelp, maybe I was unlucky and their mix on that day had too much green onion. At least the flavor was good and the pancake was crispy, though. The awesome thing about the pancake is the abundance of "seafood". Almost every bite had a piece of tasty squid!  I then ordered the soon tofu combo: hot stone bibimbap (my staple entree) and pork soup with white base (non-spicy). It was pretty good; the bibimbap taste like what it should be with very crispy edges. The amount of flavor and saltiness was good. I usually don't order soon tofu's so I'm not expert, but the soup was okay. The pork pieces were a bit hard and dry but the base was very clean and tasty.   I would love to return to GOGI to try out different dishes so I can re-adjust my reviews accordingly. As a first-timer experience, GOGI did not turn me away.

fUwSbOHyZb7UuAY-2UCAkA.text: Exactly what I expect for Korean restaurant. Was told about how good their foods taste. I am satisfied with the choice.   The food are just as delicious as my photoshows. It's better to go as a group, so you can share many different dishes. The portion is huge enough for hungry people like me.  Stone Rice bowl is HUGE.

Wish other korean place offer this option as I want soup and one more dish!   I had kalbi ( good! Thicker cut meat than some other place) mixed tofu soup ( clam and mussels pretty fresh) and pork lettuce wrap! ( love their side kimuchi wish they'd cut off the cartilage better though)   Overall i like this place! Kimchi was much more flavorful than some other place, side dish amount is a lil small but that's okay they give complimentary hot egg dish !   Closer to Vegas/Cali korean place :) tofu soup wasn't deep flavor but very clean and I like that ' will try them again for other yummy stuff!   Service was awesome too :)

n8nWXcIovANYAmB7Pb8faw.text: West-facing front in the northwest corner of the shopping center.  You can't see it from Lee Lee.  I was just there for the first time and got take-out, but I'm looking forward to going back and dining in because the food was great and the atmosphere was dark and quiet, which I like.  Friendly staff, and the bulgogi that I brought home with me was delicious, as were the sides.  I'll be back to dine in and try the sushi.  Long overdue update: I've been back many times to dine in, tried many menu items, and as far as I can tell you can't go wrong. All of the menu items I've tried are great, I love the atmosphere, and the service is always friendly and courteous. One of my favorite places. If I could give them another star I would.

CRSfd5h99qt8xGl4JyUGhg.text: Not recommended really. I love Korean food and BBQ but this place is understaffed and busy. The food is average. Not great. It needs a complete makeover. The bathrooms are gross right next to the kitchen. Makes no sense. They keep food in big bowls right next to the bathroom. Can't imagine that will last long. It's a Korean thing I guess. Don't know though. We don't have to be that authentic. More wait staff and cleaning overhaul and I'll come back eventually.

RIYnnntiaJX-cyi-0IBNqA.text: Yum! This was my first time at a Korean restaurant, and it was so good! Although not the nicest ambiance, inside is really clean! We had the seafood pancake to start, which was delicious. I had a hot stone bowl, which was also delicious and a TON of food! I had lunch the next day too. The friends I went with had the Korean bbq, which they said was delicious. Overall a really great experience, and I will definitely be back soon to try some of their other dishes - can't wait!

zVCSLWXJIhcoXnm3hX2L7Q.text: Great new Korean restaurant in the East Valley.  Went here for the first time with some foodie friends last night.  Nice clean atmosphere with the usual Korean and Sushi menu.  We wanted to try just the Korean dishes so we could compare.  1. Korean Omelet Appetizer: If you like egg dishes then this is a must try.  Cooked perfectly (little wet - the way I like it) and flavor was fresh and was seasoned just right.  2. Fresh Water Eel Hot Stone Rice Bowl: Generous portion of one of my favorite dishes.  Rice and vegetables were perfectly balance and the sauce was superb.  The sunny side egg and eel on top was great.  Stir together with your preferred qty of sauce at the table and you will not be disappointed.  3. Galbi: great flavoring and cut.  Only complaint was I wished there was more.  4. Spicy Beef Stew:  Good balance of hotness and flavor.    My favorite part of our visit was the service.  The three girls that took our order and served our table were all extremely friendly and sincerely wanted to make our dinner memorable and enjoyable.  Our water glasses were never empty and the sides and rice were always continually offered.  Even one of our friends arrived late at closing time and they made him feel welcomed and brought him plenty rice and sides as he joined us.  Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Korean Omelet: must try if you like egg dishes.  Would have this for breakfast everyday if I could :)
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Galbi and Fresh Water Eel Hot Stone Rice Bowl. Yum!

v5o6lrkPBao-e6xHWY9Ulw.text: Best Korean food in AZ. I've been waiting for a restaurant worthy of the East Valley Korean title belt; hodori and chodang always fell a bit short. GOGI has finally satisfied my need!  I went with a group of friends last night and we had the soon tofu, haemul pajun, bulgogi, assorted caviar stone rice bowl, and bibim nengmyun (buckwheat noodles). We also had the sushi which was all very fresh. The food was all great. And the unlimited sides were all yummy too.  I would definitely recommend this place and be coming as a regular.

JZeVqg48WwYOUxrwvvYRrA.text: The restaurant is a great place with yummy food and the waitress is very nice. YUMMY IN MY TUMMY!!!! The food is pretty good but the kim chi is the yummiest ...My favorite food is the pork.The waitress constantly check on us and ask if we need anything. REALLY GOOD. I didnt expect it  to be like that nice .Keep up with your good job. NICE WORK I am going to give you 5 stars. !!!!!! A a kid

OL4d2ddy1MUgTTfV4luREA.text: This place is a solid place to get KBBQ and I went here twice in one week (once for dinner and once for lunch). They weren't super busy for either lunch or dinner even though we had parties of 7/10 people which was nice. The food itself was pretty solid and it's one of the first places I've seen that serves KFC (Korean fried chicken) and kbbq together! I recommend getting a seafood pancake to start off which is enough to give a solid piece to 6 people.   We ordered a myriad of food to try a little bit of everything such as galbi, spicy pork, bugolgi and their Korean fried chicken as well! All the meats are solid although not amazing (Galbi seemed a little over cooked and not as tender as it could be). The bibimbap itself is a large portion and was way more food than I could finish by myself. Solid place to get KBBQ although I usually prefer AYCE...

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bibimbap

EIeAAXtDi7mWm2bRmlf1XQ.text: I've been here many times because it's one of the best Korean restaurants I have been to.   I come here a lot the service is quick and they give out food right away. No complaints with my friends so far, except just waiting on water.  The food portions are huge so you get a decent amount for your money. I get the Bimbimbop and the tofu stew when I come there. Super delicious and yummy!  I would come here all the time if I crave Korean food!

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States

GPFn_BE8nCVQxLPrrFshjA.text: The service was a little bit slow but our food was actually great! I ordered the Philadelphia roll and a miso soup.   I would definitely come back to try their Korean food as I didn't have the chance to really explore the menu. It was quite busy on Friday night so I'm not too hung up on the wait  time.

nKKExh_wwIlGGcxO3t78eQ.text: This may not be a fancy or trend setting "hot and new" spot amidst all of the Korean and Asian fusion restaurants that are popping up everywhere, but this is a different animal my friend.  Traditional Korean food, big flavor, big portions, friendly prices. Service is laid back and friendly. Stone bowl bibimbap was sizzling and savory...I'm getting a hunger pain just thinking about it. Good bulgogi. Kimchi fried rice good. Ban chan dishes were good. Some Japanese items on the menu like teriyaki and katsu style fish/chicken.   Don't forget to share some Soju with a friend! Or by yourself, I'm not judging..  Depending on what mood your in, make sure u consider trying  Gogi. If your tastebuds are looking for the equivalent of your favorite sweatpants, go here...it is comforting, low maintenance, and satisfying AF.

L-qhRSgMXq6hZ20vz0oSEQ.text: Korean Fried Chicken perfection! This is the best I have ever had. We order original and garlic Korean fried chicken combination plate which is about 20 pieces of chicken. We ordered two chicken fried rice orders because I wasn't sure if one would be enough for my boys and I. One was more than enough. The other thing I didn't know came with the meal was these little appetizers of pickled vegetables, potatoes, & kimchi. The service was great, dining area clean. The prices were right for the amount of food you get. My husband has been here a few times as well and was never disappointed with the quality of food or service.

bCme53k1Jpo3N4hwguGqHA.text: Love the variety of Korean fares. I had the pork and tofu soon dubu (soup) and it was delicious. I also had spicy squid and pork belly and it hit the spot. Everything was good!! I will be back for some bibimbap later

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spicy Squid and Pork Belly with the ban chan around it.

vpgFrF2EMkP01tIZWZgrSg.text: I meant to write this a long time ago. Fun place, nice decor and the constant K-Pop videos playing on the TVs make it entertaining. I forget what we ordered but, it was delicious and very flavorful.  If I was to have 1 complaint, it would be the amount of pin bones in the fish but, that is more likely a complaint against nature and not the food.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States

Tz6UymA39uuEoEsHDTWfQA.text: Even though I don't live in Arizona, I've been multiple times during my visits home. Gogi is usually on the rotation of Korean restaurants that my family goes to. The variety of dishes is big, I can usually get all the Korean dishes here. The portions are huge, and we have a great time sharing them family-style. The dishes and banchan are quality and delicious. My favorites are the seafood tofu soup, the seafood pancake, and kalbi. Yummm.  As for the service, one time I accidentally dropped my metal chopsticks while eating (I know, I know, Party foul. A server walking by just handed me some spares they had in their apron. Wooooow!

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States

dUxYVAQAzut-NrtGcrWUFg.text: For Korean food, Gogi is the best quality and value. I really love the KFC at this place! I highly recommend the green onion fried chicken which comes with a pile of shredded green onions and a wasabi dipping sauce. Of course, the usual spicy fried chicken is also delicious.  My second favorite dish here is the beef brisket soup. Its comfort food to me when it's cold outside or you just want something simple. I prefer the brisket soup to the rib soup because the flavor was better. You would think they would be the same and maybe it was the day I went but I thought the brisket soup had a more homemade flavor and of course more meat to eat. It is also served with a large cup of chopped green onions.  Their hot stone bibimbaps are great and so are the soon tofu soups. I used to go to the korean place north of downtown Chandler for tofu soup but Gogi's are better and you don't have to wait forever for a table.  What is also awesome? This place is open until 1am on the weekends. In the mood for some K-Pop and KFC, hit this place. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Boiling bowl of beef rib soup. Comfort food!
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Mixed Soon Tofu Soup
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Tofu Bibimbap

KSW8OfuImpUCJB9My5am-Q.text: When I entered the restaurant, Korean music videos were playing on the three tvs. The waitress greeted me and asked me to wait until she cleared a table. Then, she motioned for me to come over to the table once it was cleaned. The restaurant was busy and it took a little while for me to give my order to the waiter. They were so busy they didn't get a chance to check on me or ask if I wanted more of the banchan.  I ordered the beef tofu soup and the bulgogi. The meat was good quality where it wasn't chewy or stringy. The soup lacked a bit of flavor, but it was decent nonetheless. I had ordered spicy and it was the right level for me. The side dishes included fish cakes, kimchee, fermented radish strips, pickled squash, and pickled kimchee cucumbers. The bulgogi had a sweet sauce on it. I was surprised because I am more used to savory sauces on the bulgogi. The amount of food looked a bit small for the price, based on other Korean restaurants that I have been to. I think if I go back I'll try something else like the spicy rice cake or the yakisoba.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States

w1kYX-yResEHkpX1Xpw_mA.text: With a lot of friends from all over Asia here in the valley, we are always talking about flavors and food. I had blown them off a few times for lunch but when they all said this was one of their favorite places, I just had to check it out.   Came in for dinner (as i had Snowtime dessert... just next door) on my mind for afterwards. We went with the traditional Hot Stone Bibimbap and the server broke it down to us. The chicken pictures I saw pulled my attention so I decided to order more than my stomach could handle. We have 2 Bibimbap (bulgogi as I wanted my own), and order of dumplings and yeah, 2 different orders of chicken... The sweet & spicey along with the Garlic Fried chicken... I had no clue they were half chickens so when they showed up to the table, I could only think "to go box please"...   Food was good and it really opened me up more and more to Korean foods. The sides were good and even though I'm not a big kimchi fan, I enjoyed. When I come with friends, we will have to do a table as the booths are a bit snug to my liking. Good food!

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States

5CbJ2nNsEVQHnIDanTXHjQ.text: My boyfriend and I ended up looking for a late dinner around 8pm and was around here and decided to give this place a try. They were closing soon, so we knew we had to order and eat fast. They served us banchan prior our entrees.  - Kimchee fried rice: The portions were huge and I wish the egg was cooked so that it was slightly runny, but it was a bit dry instead. We were able to take the fried rice home, because it was such a huge portion that we weren't able to finish. Decent, but not the best I've had. - Slow Cooked Bulgogi Stew: This dish came out a lot larger than we thought too. My boyfriend had two large beef bones in his stew with his glass noodles and veggies. I thought this dish was very bland, which gives us little faith in the rest of the food here. The portion was generous though.   Overall, we felt rushed since the place was empty and close to closing, but the food itself wasn't as memorable as we wished. The service was decent. If we were to return, we would try the fried chicken or hot stone dishes as they seem to be the better dishes according to other Yelpers.

3A7WDdp1F4H0LYD13Cv00A.text: We recently came to Gogi for a team lunch and I will definitely be back in the future! The food was amazing and the service matched. When I pointed out that I was missing my entree the server was very pleasant and got it out to me ASAP. Everyone loved their meals and the appetizers were delicious.

ceBjaFd_NkKYbIWyUvEC0g.text: Gogi's atmosphere is dark vinyl booths and Formica tables.  It's a little dark but there's a steady flow of people and lively conversations.  My table could have been a little cleaner.  My concerns reduced when I saw the menu and disappeared completely when I tasted the side veggies waiting for my gogi.  I ordered the spicy pork bulgogi but there were lots of things like the stone bowl bibimbap, Korean fried chicken and noodle dishes that I can't wait to get back and try.    The spicy pork was a nice sharing size but it was so delicious it disappeared before I knew it.     I would have liked more vegetables but my server never checked in.  I'm sure they would have hooked me up but maybe it was shift change or something.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spicy pork bulgogi and vegetables

SuWE2Z0dHGVPbaTZ2jhrgg.text: The staff at Gogi were very nice. However, I was not super impressed with the food. I'm half Korean so maybe my opinion may be a little harsh but I did not feel the side dishes were up to par with a lot of the other Korean restaurants in the area. Tofu soup is my favorite and this one here was a little too thick for my liking. My friend did order the bulgogi and she enjoyed her meal.

EKAKe8bJ8iQNYHOfaguQ2Q.text: Boy this place has dropped quickly. Ordered the Bulgogi for dinner and barely received a lunch portion. Also gave us plastic forks for dinner - $17.99 dinner deserves a damn real fork. We had to beg for sides multiple times. Ask for water. Won't be back here anytime

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Plastic damn fork. Although the taste is amazing- the portion sucked!

JXXqHvQ4u2sSGpYqn8BdEA.text: Good kimchi and accoutrements. Chicken bulgogi was very good. Brisket soup was ok. Out of braised mackerel so settled for the fried salmon. It was good.   First time here, will give it another try soon.

8gNIXstz92k_Y-ryTG_RSQ.text: My boyfriend and I are both half Korean and were raised on Korean food IN Korea, and we both agree that this has to be the WORST Korean restaurant in all of Arizona. We ordered the spicy pork belly, mackerel, and seafood soft tofu soup. The spicy pork marinade tasted store-bought (there was a strange preservative-like aftertaste), the soup was basically just hot pepper flakes and pepper paste in hot water, and the mackerel was over fried, dry, and lacked any flavor whatsoever aside from grease. It was a complete waste of money going here and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone ever.

iDYepZmVzWg8psGdl_ngOg.text: I was craving for Korean food last night and ChoDong and BanChan were closed on Tuesday so this is the next closest restaurant that was opened. We arrived around 6:00 pm and there were 3 tables. It smelled really good with grilled meat coming from the kitchen and that was a good sign!  We were seated right away! They went out of Hite beer so I tried the Cass. Very light.  Next we ordered and waited. The place started filling up and by the time we got our food we didn't see our waiter again. Looked like they were under staffed and with 2 people taking care of 15 + tables you are not going to get much service.  I wanted the refill of my banchan so we had to wave at them several times and finally after we almost finished the food the banchan came.   The seafood pancake was the highlight of the evening very crispy but the bulgogi and soon tofu soup combo was just ok.  My problem was there was some bugs flying around. I had to guard my food. And they serve my soup in a serious crack bowl! Please please replace your broken stone wear is ugly and I don't want to eat foreign objects.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Seriously cracked stone bowl serving my Soon Tofu soup

E6zXp8nhuCXOQn3vECbQCw.text: Today around 1pm I tried Gogi for the first time with a friend. To start I was happy to walk in the door, be greeted immediately, and sat right away.     The gentleman that sat us oferred to take drink orders,  we both ordered waters. Me being antsy and hungry, I placed an order for the pork dumplings off of the appetizers menu to start. He returned soon after with the waters and the dumplings weren't far behind.     A waitress handled the rest of our stay at Gogi and took our order for our main courses. I ordered the lunch special Hot Stone bibimbap with beef bulgogi added(she mentioned it was an upcharge.. I appreciate knowing that ahead of time) which comes with the soon tofu soup. I ordered the kimchi tofu soup, she made sure to let me know that it was going to be sour and spicy.. I didn't know much of what to expect but I was willing to try it.  My friend ordered the spicy pork bulgogi with the mushroom tofu soup.     None of the food took very long to come out to us, all of which was hot and cooked to perfection. We spent most of the meal picking off each others plates, unable to decide which meal we liked more. I wasn't crazy over the Kimchi soup but I believe that was more of an unfamiliarity with the flavor then it being cooked incorrectly.     All of the staff was attentive, quick to help, checked up on us several times, and made us feel very welcomed. I am happy to see that the incredible ratings gogi currently has are for a reason.     We are already planning our next trip there. Thank you Gogi!

M3yLuWRgZqViClqJpsmehg.text: First time having soon tofu soup and it was great! Surprisingly filling, it was a great size. We got dumplings too, so delish but the sauce it came with didn't make sense with it. All in all, I would definitely recommend!!

MkgoEiQu6VtDOzjqzkysZw.text: I ordered Korean Chirash, the sashimi were cut into tiny pieces and some are just fish skins.  The sashimi had bad fish smell and were brown.  It looked like leftover sashimi.  I am not going back there again to eat in or take out.

MVBTuZYHxkHfD297w3EOQQ.text: This place has a nice family feel to it.  Staff are friendly and food is very good.  The bulgogi, seafood pancake, spicy pork, kim chee fried rice, bimbambap are all very good with generous portions.

_BESW2fCJQFTLNbojGhiQQ.text: I went to Gogi for lunch special and I wrote a review blog post about my experience. Check it out! :) itsmesteph.com/gogi-kore...

Z469V3NQhvFRehUkucNV3Q.text: Was sadly disappointed.  Everything was soggy and overly sweet, from banchans to bibimbap to japchae to the soon tofu.  Could hardly finish our meal.  Galbi was just ok.  There weren't that many people there at 8pm and yet service was pretty slow.  No one refilled water or banchans.

ofQYAAEMPAJUuESzgV4z4w.text: Soju, kalbi, bossam, oh my!  I really thought my days of associating with Koreans were over since I left San Diego for the valley, and that I would have to travel back to Cali to find decent Korean food.  I've already written of my struggles to find chaminsul soju in AZ, so I was glad to see Jinro on their shelf. I can't speak to service as I got an order to go, but the waiter who helped me was friendly which is more than you normally get in Ktown LA, so that's a plus.  The kalbi and spicy pork belly were both as good as what I have gotten in Socal, so I was extremely pleased. Their banchan was good as well.  Maybe one of these days I'll get people to join me for a soju party, but until then, the to go order I had will have to satisfy my needs till then.  Kam samida yo!

KKV-Q3jY_lJ2P9l2gusNCA.text: I admit that I have such a mistake going here around noon time. The restaurant is extremely crowded with only 2 waitstaff, and I finally get to order my food in 20mins since I step in. There are not many authentic Korean cuisines in the East Valley; but I have visited some within my residence, and I would say this place does not stand out from the rest. My lunch selections are Bulbogi, beef fried rice, and beef tofu soup (Lunch options). Zucchini and fish cake side plates taste awesome, and the other 3 are pretty acceptable. The Bulgogi is great and the thinned texture of meat absorbs the spices , but beef fried rice is very greasy with dried cubed beef, which makes it hard to chew. The tofu in the soup is starting to turn sour, and the rice from the combo is also dry and not so good.   Being short of staff really makes the dining experience a challenge. Despite the waiter keeps apologizing for the delay (and I totally understand), there's nothing in this place can keep me to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lunch all in one

OCnwzwFjU99CtSEAEEzx-g.text: I went few days ago. The services still awesome! They always checked on us and asked how was the food! OMG, the banchan was bomb! We end up asked like 2 times..lol...Definitely will go back! We ordered galbi and ugh i forgot but overall awesome! Definitely will go back to try pork belly!

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States

MjNZqq7snu8qXSNUbBnJnw.text: I like the hot plate bibimbap with bulgogi. Also had the steamed egg (fluffy egg souffle) and the spicy pork with kimchi and tofu. The sauce that they bring out with the bibimbap is tasty. We went on a sunday evening and the service was good. They kept an eye out for empty side dish plates and replaced them with new ones. They asked us how was everything during the meal. And they gave us boxes and a bag at the end of the meal. I can't complain.

Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. hot plate bibimbop, bulgogi

682MwQbqO_rrPIY0QqE1Wg.text: I already can't wait to go back to GOGI and try more things on their menu. So yummy!!!  Hubby and a friend went with the pork and bulgogi hot stone bowl. I'm pretty sure the bowls were about 10 inches in diameter, so definitely huge portions. More importantly, it was delicious (hubby allowed me a bite) and I loved how the rice got a little crispy from the heat of the bowl. I went with the spicy squid and pork belly and was in heaven!!  They also brought out a bunch of sides which came with the meal - fish cake, radish, potato, kimchi...awesome variety!!  We went on a Friday night right around 5 and were only one of a couple small groups within the restaurant. By 5:30, the place was packed, so I recommend going early. Next time, hot pot is on my list to try!!

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spicy squid and pork belly. DELISH!!

O4Y77lEqmfRQJZ2RelIHBA.text: (Lyrics - Bell Biv Devoe - Poison)  Hey I must tell you......! I sense something tasty in my mouth Situation is serious......! Let's try it cause we're running out of time It's oh so delicious.....! Bo Bites reviews they seem from the start It's all so lyrical......! When food is ready from the start  It's driving me out of my mind! That's why it's not hard for me to try Can't get it out of my mouth Miss it, taste it, love it That place is GOGI......!  Solid! Solid as a rock!    GOGI delivers to me in my book...and palate!  Located in the heart of what I call the Phoenix Asian mecca, GOGI's location is perfect to showcase to the Asian community.  GOGI's is modern and subtle like a model home display.  Not my cup of tea I guess.  Service was spot on though and very attentive and helpful when my buddy and I needed some suggestions.    We started with the Seafood Pancakes, which came with a ponzu-like sauce in a bowl full of jalapeno peppers.  Overall a nice start, the pancakes were nice and soft in the middle and crunchy at the edges with small cuts of calamari giving it some extra texture.  For our entree with shot for the Spicy Pork Belly and the Bulgogi Beef Hot Stone Bowl.  Boy did we hit the jackpot!  The Spicy Pork Belly was somewhat fatty, but overall the taste was music to my palates.  Tender with a hint of chewiness, the flavors was sweet and spicy; I could eat this all day with some rice!  Our Bulgogi beef hot bowl came with of course Bulgogi beef, bean sprouts, slivered carrots, spinach, cucumbers, and crusty rice....yeahhhh!  I love it when the rice at the bottom of the bowl  hardens giving this entree a crunchy punch.  They give you a sweet red sauce to liven up the dish since you can definitely smell and taste the strong sesame sauce oil they use to cook it.    Overall my kind of place to come to!  Seems like a family owned spot with some care and love to the craft.  In the end, it's an A in my books! - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States

TKSKgikctLYpcp3iVdrfag.text: Best Korean in Arizona. Stop in and try it. The staff is so friendly and they make great food. I eat hear once a month.

QmBmlrC1pcc7WJD_U38EEA.text: Good Korean food and the portions are huge. It is a little pricey but you do get what you pay for. It was very busy when I went and I waited at least 30mins for my food. I didn't mind waiting since the service I got was decent and the waiter did come up to me to apologize for the wait and kept updates on the food. He also offered more side dishes for me to try while waiting so I didn't mind since they were basically free appetizers to me. They have quite a selection for both lunch and dinner on the menu. Lunch prices are MUCH cheaper than dinner, but I'm unsure about the portion size for lunch as I only went for dinner time. They also have sushi on the menu.   One problem for me was the design of this place. I don't understand it. It's a little bit weirdly designed and off vibe for me. I don't feel cozy or comfortable sitting in the restaurant. It's just an off interior design for me. Another problem is that they don't have pictures on the menu to show the food. I like pictures on my menu so I know what I'm ordering, especially when I'm with someone who isn't use to eating cultured food. Other than that, the food is pretty bomb.

photos.caption: Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Hot stone rice pot- Bulgogi
Photo of GOGI - Chandler, AZ, United States. Kimchi Fried Rice

CR5CNeSTpXu6XAFP5k0q0Q.text: Location: it is located in the same plaza as Lee Lee supermarket. There are many tables as well as booths to choose from. Restaurant is relatively clean. Parking is limited in front of the restaurant, but you can always park closer to the supermarket and walk over.   Service: I love the staffs! They are always friendly and attentive every single time I am here. Occasionally, the owners behind the kitchen will waive at us on our way out.   Food: they have this combo that allows you to order a decent size dish (ex: Korean BBQ or Ribs) that comes with a Tofu soup of your choice. That is what I normally order here. If you know Kim Chi, theirs are always fresh and generous when you need refill. I also love their spicy fish red noodles.   Rating: I am a regular here and this is one of my favorite Korean restaurants in AZ.
